title: 110_s1368
content: The "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. It outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, the acceptance of matching funds for projects, and personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, acceptance of matching funds for projects, and personnel matters. Amendments include changes to member compensation and appointment of necessary personnel. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to change the Economic Development Committee's section number and grant flexibility in its operations by replacing "shall" with "may". The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to grant special functions to the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, and management of Commission projects, as well as initiatives for Alaskan youths. Amounts made available for the program remain accessible until used. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The Commission shall provide assistance for teacher housing needs, including housing development activities like acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
